direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return reason phrases for error codes, but getReasonPhrase retrieves a custom phrase set by the user, while getDefaultReasonPhrase provides a default phrase based on the error code.
Both methods handle the manipulation of reason phrases, with getReasonPhrase retrieving the stored phrase and setReasonPhrase setting a new one.
getReasonPhrase relies on the error code to provide context for the reason phrase, and getErrorCode provides the error code that can be used to retrieve the corresponding reason phrase.
Setting the error code with setErrorCode can influence the behavior of getReasonPhrase, as the reason phrase might be derived or influenced by the error code set.

Both methods involve the manipulation of error-related data, with encode converting the error code and reason phrase into a binary format, and getReasonPhrase retrieving the reason phrase in a human-readable format.
